reviews.review_msg: Prof sends out 1 email/week about weekly topics. Course graded on discussions(min.600words/week), reading activities(700words/week),& 3 assignments. You're teaching yourself from the textbook. Wouldn't take this course if not a requirement. Topics in the text are interesting but wished the prof had added more to the class. Fairly easy marker though

I honestly don't know why Maureen gets so much criticism. I have taken EDUC422 w/ her & currently taking 315 & it is going well. Her assignments are a little vague, so you have to kind of just trust your judgement and do what you think she wants, but she makes very reasonably. She is also super kind when it comes to emails & questions!

Maureen is a chaotic & disorganized prof. She forgot to show up to class once. She often contradicted herself, especially about assignments which made it hard to know what was expected. She didn't give any grades or feedback back during the semester & released them all at the end of the course with the final grade, so we didn't know how to improve

Maureen seems like a very sweet lady, but I would not take a course with her again. She rarely replies to emails, criteria for assignments is unclear, and marks are docked for the smallest things (which again, are not clearly outlined in criteria). You're required to read the textbook in its entirety - I had a hard time keeping up in this course.

The prof provided no material to the class, the only resource is reading the textbook which is very dense and hard to read through. I studied through the whole course load by myself and she provided no support or explanation of concepts. Overall very disappointed by the class structure and lack of engaging material.

This class was extremely theory driven and taught me nothing about learning disabilities or how to help those with LD in the classroom. The readings were disconnected and not helpful for assignments. The text book is dense, hard to read and not very applicable. I don't know about the professor, but the course itself was disappointing.

Dr. Hoskyn is a very caring professor. She really cares about supporting her students and scaffolding their learning. She organized our grad class around very useful peer reviewed sessions from which we learned a lot. Though it meant so much extra work for her, she gave us feedback on multiple stages of our essay writing. She is a wonderful prof.

I reccomend taking this in person It was content heavy but,I did find collaborating with group members helpful. The midterm and the final were all written questions (short answer and an essay) HOWEVER, we were allowed to bring the textbook each time and bring in one page of notes double sided. The TM was alright but took weeks to mark assignments.

She needs to revise the 422 course content and materialboth for in-class and online. Assignment requirements are unclear, APA format requirements are wrong (come on; 1.5 spacing?), and the textbook is so incomprehensible and theory-filled that it is not practical at all. The readings for an assignment do not give the necessary information.

In terms of IN CLASS courses, Professor Hoskyn was great. She was very understanding when it came to student feedback on assignments, tests, & readings. If something was unappealing, she took students' responses into consideration & altered the assignments. Overall, tests were very long & make sure you explain in detail and support your claims.

For the 315 online course, it was my first online class at SFU so I made sure I never fell behind (in fact ahead for once). As long as you put effort into the assignments every week, the final shouldn't be as intimidating. I actually got a really good mark this way... The final I needed the 3hr. Who cares about instructor not being present?

People shouldn't blame her this much because SFU just puts a prof's name on SIS to make the course look legitimate & it's not the prof's responsibility to teach an online class.. If you have any course to take with her, take it IN-CLASS. She is kind and helpful. You will hear a lot of interesting information relevant to Special Education.

Pointless name as she has not even one percent input in the course, the course is run by TM who is evading, vague and unsure. No clue about what to expect in the written exam. Useless and disappointing. It took me three hours to attempt half of the exam in the open book as it was totally unexpected. There was nothing from what we did for 13 weeks:(

There's isn't much I can add that hasn't already been said, scroll down and read the other comments because it's all true. I don't understand what her role is anyways, you never hear from her and it's always the TA that you're communicating with an marking everything. The instructions are SO unclear and vague for assignments, it's ridiculous.

This course was a lot of work. There was no interaction with the instructor and the TA had a habit of delivering snobby, cutting comments. The marking for the tutoring assignment did not align with the course rubric. Exams were essay written. Class average on the exams was brutal 50-60%. If you are looking for an elective do not take this course!

This course really didn't teach me anything that I hadn't already learned in EDUC 315. This course was much less engaging, the exams were extremely difficult and focused on memorizing specific, small details from the texts. Very disappointed. Assignments are slightly more interesting, but exams are brutal. Don't take this if you can avoid it.

I took this class and never heard from the prof at all! The TA instructs you on what to do and helps with questions. More than 60% of the mark is based on an app review, you reflect on some, you create your own review with a  script/storyboard/video! I thought it was pointless. Weekly discussions are mandatory :( not a fun or easy course

Was interested in the course prior to taking it. In the end it was of little use when it came to application in a teaching setting. EASY marking by the TA and ZERO input/interaction with Prof until she clarified the expectation of the exam 48 hours before writing the final. Prof was not available at exam time for clarification on an exam question.

I took this course via DE and it is a lot of work for 3 credits. There's a discrepancy between readings and assignments. Don't expect to interact with the instructor too much as most feedback will be from the TA. I have taken a course with Maureen prior and she is a very sweet lady. Despite the negative ratings, I would definitely recommend her.

Two 500 word assignments, a MT, final, & a paper based off tutoring a child with disabilities 6x. Do everything you're told to for the assignments & write a good paper, because the exams are tricky & all short answer. If you succeed on the assignments/discussions there's less pressure for the difficult exams!

Completely disorganized course, textbook, course material and assignments do not align. Group discussions often changed last minute due to content not actually working, the assignment deadlines were unorganized and overall it was poorly administrated. Content itself was useless, in spite of my high interest in the subject.

A totally disorganized course lacking cohesion. Assignments oftentimes not corresponding assigned readings. Late responses and marking from our TA. The textbook was alright, although theories in it seemed quite outdated.
Awful class, terribly designed and no cohesion between text, weekly assignments/discussions, assignments and final exam was set up for students to fail. Complete disappointment!

I took this course in lecture form because I try to avoid online courses. I really enjoyed this course. Our classes were supposed to be 4 hrs long but I don't think we've ever had a full length class. They mainly involved discussions, videos and VERY short slides. No exams, just assignments and 1 final paper. Avoid DE and take the in-class version

A) I feel the need to put a good review out here that will help people making the decision to take this course. THIS IS A REASONABLE COURSE. I took it DE & I am going to break down every single thing for you. Please disregard all the ratings below me! There are no online lectures or notes, only a textbook that is basically written like a novel.

Maureen's bias is very strong in all her lectures - stated over and over that it is a useless class resulting in Level B certification which only Educational Psychologists should administer. The course was really easy. If you didn't get perfect on the midterm, then she told you what to change and gave you time to change it. She scrapped the final.

Unbelievably frustrating course. It is incredible that we are expected to do that much work for only 4 credits. I regretted taking it after the 1st week. If the point was to make me feel learning disabled, this prof has succeeded. Rote memorization emphasized - the antithesis of our contemporary philosophy for teaching children. What a disconnect!

DO NOT TAKE!! grades will take months to come back, you have no contact with the prof and the TA is m.i.a all term. You will have to bust your ass to cover a ton of material only to take the exams which cover a measly 1/8th of the class. Worst class i have taken at SFU

DO NOT TAKE this course by distance for your GPA! The instructions are extremely vague and the only feedback you get if from your TA. The professor has no contact with the students. The TA is often away from the discussion board. The exams are unrelated. The marks you get on the assingnments will confuse you.

This course (dist ed.) seems easy until you go into the final. The final is not at all related to the study questions or learning objectives. They are based on very detailed facts in the textbooks. AVOID!

I took this course by distance education. You need to work with a student outside your time. This course should be worth 8 credits! By the way, the TA hardly ever gives out an A. Her marking standards are bizarre. She can go to H-ll and f--k herself.

I am a 4th year student and i took this class, possibly one of the hardest classes iv ever taken. avoid it like the plauge. you only deal with the TA. The assingments arnt to bad. i had an A going into the final.. but the final is nothing like the class!! very very specific questions avoid it if you care at all about your GPA

IF YOU CAN AVOID THIS CLASS, AVOID IT!! The online version of this class is out of this world. The most difficult undergrad course i have ever taken. The prof is unavailable to help you and the TA is takes forever, to mark and answer questions. I would follow the instructions for the assignments and still do horrible.

DO NOT TAKE THIS COURSE IF YOU DON'T HAVE TO!  There is a lot of reading and information to remember!  It's difficult!  The instructions on assignment are contradictory and confusing.  Took it online, never even heard from the Prof., and TA is not very good...

She is unavailable to help you and the TA is the only resource you have for the class. If you send her an email about anything she will not respond back to you. If you can avoid taking her course then DON'T take her!

-Assignments poorly explained and heavily weighted. Exams were unnecessarily hard (and I did study). Maureen unavailable for comment. Tutor marker unavailable for comment. Would not reschedule my final due to extenuating circumstances, no consideration, despite Maureen's own illness during term. Do not take this course! Your GPA will suffer.
The Educ315 Dist Ed course is not an easy course! There are tons of assignments and very heavy readings. But if you keep up with the course and put in the time, you will be fine.

Wow. Professor would not answer questions. Not even about final exam or major assingments. Course material was easy and very readeable. Would not take this course if you are not seriously interested in learning disabilities.

I took this class by distance and it was terrible. Either this course should be 6 credits or this should be the only course you choose for the semester. It was ridiculous! I don't recommend it to anyone!

Didn't directly associate with Maureen Hoskyn, just the ta but the class, via distance ed.- very heavy work load!  an assignment due every single week for the first month and half.  Assignments at time did not even pertain to course!  Way too many readings and work for an undergrad course.
Very high work load. Very specific in marking and what she expects.
Took the lecture class, not distance ed. It was a good class, highly recommend it! She is helpful and really knows the subject and current research and legal policies. No complaints!
If you take this through distance education, focus on the courseware more.  She's gonna ask specific questions in the final exam.  She's so into details.  However, the TA was nice.

DO NOT take this course AT ALL. It is a giant waste of time. I took it by distance, there was very little instruction the final exam is multiple choice and short answer while the course was over 800 pages of reading with weak guidlines. Grading too was unjustified. Sucked royally

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS BY DISTANCE ED.  The TA is unhelpful, I couldn't even understand what some of the questions on the midterm were asking due to weird syntax, it's an insane amount of work for a small amount of marks...Get "the gist" of the articles and carefully read the text if you end up taking this class.

I took the DE course last semester. Interesting course. Most of the articles were interesting, but the textbook was boring. The paper was okay, but the final was unfair (warning: might need to memorize minute and obscure facts, some test items included obscure details we were not told to study on the objective list).

I took this class via distance-ed this semester...from reading the other entries..distance ed sounded like the better option. there definitly is ALOT of reading...if you take it distance ed i would advise focusing more on the journal articles than on the actual textbook. Final was hard.

Awful course. It's the new WebCT Dist Ed course. Would NEVER recommend it to anyone. Too much reading.  Stressful courseload. Grammar mistakes flying everywhere on the midterm. Although she does recognizes problems students are having and try to ease the load. I know many people hate the course.

loved this course, but it was a lot of work.maureen answers any & all questions with a smile, but trust me, you will have A LOT of questions!lectures are only beneficial for hearing assignments guidelines.your stress level will hit a new high in 424!

The course was a total waste of time. I learned more just by reading the text than attending class. We read articles and discussed them among our peers during class. No teaching whatsoever. Basically distance ed in a classroom. Maureen is really nice.

very helpful and encouraging with assignments.  The paper is hard but lots of easy grades along the way to ease the pain of the paper grade.  Very unorganized and easily distracted, but very approachable.
very nice prof, minimal workload & easy gpa booster

Take this course via Distance Education.  It's a lot easier than if you took it up on campus.  The tutor marker is very helpful and the think papers are reasonable.  The exams are tough but if you prepare well, you'll do fine.  Worthwhile course.

A very knowledgeable prof., but has some diff. imparting info. due to frequent though interesting tangents in her discussions.  I would have found the course more accesible with overheads, powerpoint, or handouts... for clarity and direction of discussion
amen to that! as educ students, we know good teachers when we see them, and though she knows her ****, she cant teach worth it!
Very unorganized.  Nice, but doesn't get the job done
